episodes.subtitle: David, Jeff, Peter Sciretta, and Germain reconvene to discuss the results of their 2015 box office summer movie wager. Below, you’ll find the actual box office rankings for this summer, as well as Dave, Jeff, Peter, and Germain’s origina[...]
episodes.description: David, Jeff, Peter Sciretta, and Germain reconvene to discuss the results of their 2015 box office summer movie wager. Below, you’ll find the actual box office rankings for this summer, as well as Dave, Jeff, Peter, and Germain’s original rankings. 2015 Summer Movie Wager Scoring: Getting number 1 or number 10 dead-on gets you 13 points (each). The rest of the scoring goes like this: 10 points for numbers 2-9 dead-on 7 points if your pick was only one spot away from where it ended up 5 points if it was two spots away 3 points if your pick is anywhere in the Top 10 1 point for each dark horse that makes it into the Top 10 The scoring is tabulated so that you get the SINGLE HIGHEST point value for each pick- that is, if you get number ten right, you don’t get 13+3, you only get 13. Actual Top 10 list for summer 2015:  Jurassic World Avengers: Age of Ultron Inside Out Minions Pitch Perfect 2 Mission Impossible: Rogue Nation Ant-Man San Andreas Mad Max: Fury Road Straight Outta Compton Peter Sciretta’s List: Avengers: Age of Ultron Minions Jurassic World Ant-Man Ted 2 Tomorrowland Inside Out Mission: Impossible – Rogue Nation Mad Max: Fury Road Pixels Wildcards Fantastic Four San Andreas Magic Mike XXL David Chen’s List The Avengers: Age of Ultron Inside Out Minions Ant-Man Pixels Mission Impossible Rogue Nation Jurassic World Ted 2 Tomorrowland Mad Max: Fury Road Wild Cards: San Andreas Fantastic Four Terminator: Genisys Germain Lussier’s List: Avengers Age of Ultron Minions Jurassic World Inside out Mission Impossible 5 Ant-Man Spy Pixels Ted 2 Terminator Genisys Wildcards Magic Mike XXL Poltergeist Pitch Perfect 2 Jeff Cannata’s List: Avengers Minions Jurassic World Mission Impossible Inside Out Ted 2 Magic Mike XXL Mad Max Ant Man Tomorrow Land Wildcards Terminator Pitch Perfect 2 Fantastic Four Poltergeist
episodes.description_html:
David, Jeff, Peter Sciretta, and Germain reconvene to discuss the results of their 2015 box office summer movie wager. Below, you’ll find the actual box office rankings for this summer, as well as Dave, Jeff, Peter, and Germain’s original rankings.

2015 Summer Movie Wager Scoring:

  • Getting number 1 or number 10 dead-on gets you 13 points (each).

The rest of the scoring goes like this:

  • 10 points for numbers 2-9 dead-on
  • 7 points if your pick was only one spot away from where it ended up
  • 5 points if it was two spots away
  • 3 points if your pick is anywhere in the Top 10
  • 1 point for each dark horse that makes it into the Top 10

The scoring is tabulated so that you get the SINGLE HIGHEST point value for each pick- that is, if you get number ten right, you don’t get 13+3, you only get 13.

Actual Top 10 list for summer 2015: 

  1. Jurassic World
  2. Avengers: Age of Ultron
  3. Inside Out
  4. Minions
  5. Pitch Perfect 2
  6. Mission Impossible: Rogue Nation
  7. Ant-Man
  8. San Andreas
  9. Mad Max: Fury Road
  10. Straight Outta Compton

episodes.description: Its that time of year again. Jeff Cannata (formerly of the Totally Rad Show, now host of DLC, We Have Concerns and co-host of the /Filmcast) has thrown down the gauntlet, and once again challenged /Film to compete with him in what has become an annual tradition: the Summer Movie Wager. This is the ninth annual edition of this contest. This year the contest includes David Chen (his first time) Germain Lussier (with a write-in ballot), Jeff Cannata and myself in a game is to decide what will be the highest grossing films of the Summer. It’s a free-for-all; the person with the best score wins. But it isn’t just that easy — not only do the participants need to predict what 10 films will be the highest grossing films domestically, but we need to place them in order. After the jump you can watch the full episode of the show with our predictions. Peter Sciretta’s List: Avengers: Age of Ultron Minions Jurassic World Ant-Man Ted 2 Tomorrowland Inside Out Mission: Impossible – Rogue Nation Mad Max: Fury Road Pixels = July 24 Wildcards Fantastic Four San Andreas Magic Mike XXL David Chen’s List The Avengers: Age of Ultron Inside Out Minions Ant-Man Pixels Mission Impossible Rogue Nation Jurassic World Ted 2 Tomorrowland Mad Max: Fury Road Wild Cards: San Andreas Fantastic Four Terminator: Genisys Germain Lussier’s List: Avengers Age of Ultron Minions Jurassic World Inside out Mission Impossible 5 Ant-Man Spy Pixels Ted 2 Terminator Genisys Wildcards Magic Mike XXL Poltergeist Pitch Perfect 2 Jeff Cannata’s List: Avengers Minions Jurassic World Mission Impossible Inside Out Ted 2 Magic Mike XXL Mad Max Ant Man Tomorrow Land Wildcards Terminator Pitch Perfect 2 Fantastic Four Poltergeist

Be sure to rent Megan’s newest film, Lucky Them, on iTunes or Amazon. Also, listen to Marc Maron’s WTF interview with Robin Williams, and read coverage from David Chen’s new film.

You can always e-mail us at slashfilmcast(AT)gmail(DOT)com, or call and leave a voicemail at 781-583-1993. Also, like us on Facebook!

What We’ve Been Watching (03:30)

  • David: Locke, Blue Ruin
  • Jeff: The Guest
  • Devindra: The One I Love, The Knick, Lucy
  • Megan: Gunmen

Film News (38:00)

  • Lauren Bacall has passed away
  • Robin Williams has passed away

Featured Review (52:15)

  • Jodorowsky’s Dune
